elements.title: Suzie Zuzek (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Suzie Zuzek's impactful 1960s and 1970s textile designs for Lilly Pulitzer dresses (examples pictured) were recovered from under floorboards?

elements.title: carillons of the British Isles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the carillons of the British Isles were primarily constructed in the interwar period?

elements.title: Pramod Kapoor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indian author and publisher Pramod Kapoor was made a Chevalier de la Legion d'Honneur for his contribution to promoting India's heritage?

elements.title: Munida gregaria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that shoals of Munida gregaria, the gregarious squat lobster, can be up to 5 km (3.1 mi) long?

elements.title: Martha Wolfenstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Martha Wolfenstein wrote stories based on her father's experiences in a Moravian Judengasse?

elements.title: I Pity the Poor Immigrant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Dylan's song "I Pity the Poor Immigrant" uses phrases from the Book of Leviticus?

elements.title: A. K. M. Miraj Uddin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that A. K. M. Miraj Uddin set a Pakistani national record in the pole vault by clearing 12 feet 2 inches (3.71 m) with a bamboo pole instead of a carbon-fiber pole?

elements.title: a New York City office building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a New York City office building was nicknamed for its resemblance to a lipstick tube?
